Name: Finland
label: Finland is the first country in the world to make broadband access a legal right for all citizens. The country's new law, which came into effect on July 1, guarantees speeds of at least 100 megabits per second for all citizens, and those living in rural areas will be entitled to receive speeds of at least 1 gigabit per second. The law also requires all operators to provide equal access to their networks regardless of geographic location.

Name: Sweden
label: Sweden's government has announced that it is to provide an extra $3.3bn of funding to support the country's education system over the next four years. The money will go towards improving infrastructure, increasing student aid, and developing digital resources. The move comes as Sweden continues to tackle the impact of the Covid-19 pandemic.

Name: Denmark
label: Denmark has announced that it will invest an additional 500 million kroner (approx. €67 million) in green initiatives, including renewable energy, electric vehicles, and organic farming. The announcement was made by Prime Minister Mette Frederiksen at the Climate Change Action Summit in Copenhagen. The additional funds will be used to help Denmark reach its 2030 climate targets.
